I wouldn't likely recommend this course to another student. I kind of regret taking this class, to be honest. I didn't really learn anything and didn't feel challenged. I assume many people take this class for an easy grade. There are many other ways to boost your GPA and better courses that have light grading scales and are more engaging.
Absolutely. It is a lot of fun and not too difficult. The workload is manageable and the exams are easy if you pay attention in lecture.
Yes! It is extremely interesting and well taught.
Absolutely! Best class Ive taken at Yale so far.
If you are interested in the problems that modern science and medicine poses--or if you want a very engaging, not extremely difficult 5th class, take Bioethics and Law. You won't regret it.

Absolutely! Bioethics & the Law is popular for a reason its interesting, not too much work, and both lecture and section are productive. Lots of students in the class are pre-law or pre-med, but you can honestly find every type of Yale student in this class. Just be warned: if you take the class feeling like youre entitled to an A just because its an easy class, you may be disappointed. Just missing one small law on a midterm, or not effectively refuting all parts of a new law could result in an A- instead of an A. Theres not much buffer or curve, so tiny mistakes are hard to recover from to get an A. I would recommend taking as many notes as you can during lecture.
Yes definitely!
YES great class!

Yes, I would recommend this course. It is not only important for someone going into law or medicine, but also research. Additionally, it is good for any inhabitant of the US to take such a course, because it informs them of their basic rights.
I would recommend this course, particularly if a student is looking to learn about the American health care system and the way it deals with patients. It was very interesting.
Yes
Yes! It was so interesting. I think the subject material is stuff everyone should be aware of and have an understanding of. YES!
Yes!!
Absolutely. So interesting and Latham is the most amazing lecturer.

I would recommend this course to another student. As a Humanities student, I found this course to be incredibly interesting, very approachable, and relatable in some ways. Professor Latham is an extremely engaging lecturer, and the course is structured in a way that is fair and manageable. You'll definitely come out of the course learning a lot!
Maybe. It is easy and fairly interesting but unintimate
Yes. Extremely interesting material and a great group of people teaching.

Yes, I would highly recommend this course. Normally I would answer this question such as "I would recommend this course to anyone interested in..." "neuroscience," or "learning German," or "attending medical school." However, this is the first course I've taken which I would truly recommend to any student. The material is relevant to anyone who wants to be informed on important matters, many of which may apply to himself or herself or a family member at some point n their life, and to anyone who wishes to be an informed voter. Further, it is a very fair class in which it is easy to succeed and learn a lot.
Yes! Great class about the U.S. legal system, not just about bioethics.
Yes. Very interesting class.
Yes! Great class to take before you graduate.

Absolutely. It would be a great credit/D class because the information is so interesting. I took this class for a grade and I take thorough notes by hand so I would spend every lecture furiously trying to keep up with Professor Latham, and so often I just wanted to stop and listen and really get to absorb/enjoy the lecture.
Yes. This is one of the "MUST TAKE" courses here at Yale.
Yes, because it provides interesting insight on a topic that lies in the cross section of science and law
Yes. The professor is great as well.
Yes. This course is helpful in creating better voters  even if one does not plan on entering the fields of public health or medicine.
Yes, I would recommend this to anyone wanting to gain knowledge about health-related controversies and the laws/ethics surrounding them.

I would recommend this course because the concepts are very interesting and the professor delivers information in a clear way that makes it easy for the students to understand the main points of concepts.
YES! must take for general knowledge
Yes I would recommend this cause because it was really interesting and I feel like I learned a lot and it wasn't very much work.
Yes, I would recommend this course to someone because it was interesting, well organized, and discusses important topics that are prevalent and divisive in our country.
I would! I think its a very interesting course, regardless of what you are studying.
100%. One of the best courses ive ever taken. Everybody should take this class because it is not a lot of work and so interesting.
Absolutely! This class has been my favorite at Yale so far. Regardless of whether youre interested in law or medicine, this class presents both fields in a very clear and concise manner.
yes. interesting gut.

I would definitely recommend this class to another student! If you have any interest in how science/medicine affects people's legal rights and decisions, or if you just want to better understand important current events, then this class is for you. Bioethics and law is a very crucial topic to understand for life, no matter what kind of student you are. Latham does an incredible job of explaining the concepts in a very accessible and interesting manner. Please take this class!!
If you're in a rut and need a gut, this is it folks!
Yes, very interesting material, great professor.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student. It was really interesting and fun to take.

YES. Professor Latham's lectures are insanely fascinating: he combines a traditional ethical understanding of medicine with a genuine curiosity around new technologies and how they fit in in the broader scheme of bioethics. The topics are very thought-provoking: abortion debates, organ allocation, gene editing, assisted suicide, etc. These are crucial moral conversations you would want to have with a close friend, yet Professor Latham synthesizes them in a wonderfully intellectual and systematic manner. Do watch out for TAs: there's a lot of variation, with some having very little work outside of class, and some a ton. Grade seems to depend too much on TA's discretion. Other than that, a fantastic class.
Yes!!
Too many tests and tough grading curve.

Yes! The lectures in this class were consistently fun to attend, and I found our weekly sections to be engaging and thought-provoking. It's also cool to learn about bioethics, a field that's often in the news but infrequently discussed in academic settings.

I would definitely recommend this course. It's pretty low workload - there are three exams and weekly reading responses that are graded on completeness, and once a week hour-long section. Prof. Latham is a great lecturer and the material is very interesting, and he covers a broad range of topics.

I learned so much from this class and most of the lectures were very interesting. You learn about a lot of topics: organ donation, abortion, end of life care, stem cell research, assisted reproduction, intellectual property, and public health.

If you want to learn anything interesting during your time here at Yale, definitely take this course.  The topics are already interesting but Professor Latham is also a fantastic and very entertaining lecturer which made taking Bioethics and Law that much better.  I can honestly say that this was my favorite course this semester (and one of my all-time favorite courses that I have taken).  Again, the information is extremely compelling and very applicable.  If you are pre-med, this course will give you a new perspective on your future career but if not, it is still a good course to take.  Do yourself a favor and just shop the course.  That being said, if you do take the course, know that it is NOT a gut.  The midterms are actually challenging (the final is even harder) and you do have to thoroughly know the course material (have the supreme court cases memorized and mention as many as you can in the tests).  It is also very hard not to slack since it is a huge lecture class and there is no accountability, but you can get away with just studying the week there is a midterm and not doing much in between.  As long as you go to lecture (Professor Latham covers everything that is important) and prepare well for the tests, this course is not too much work and you will walk away having learned learn tons of interesting stuff!
Yes I would. It is a very interesting lecture that I really enjoyed attending.

Yes I would, regardless of your major. The class is about medicine and law, and all of the issues discussed are relevant to basically everyone, and I believe it is really great to be aware and informed about policy that affects you.
Great class for anyone interested in medicine or bioethics law.
yes it was interesting
Yes, please take this class! It's not too hard and the material is super interesting and engaging. You will learn a lot.
I would because I felt like I gained a lot out of it and a lot of practical knowledge about important topics.
Yes. I think people with many different interests/backgrounds can gain a lot of insight from this course.
Yes, it is a course that is not too challenging and does not have a huge workload but is very interesting.

It's very interesting, and going to lecture feels like going to a show of some sort. You really don't have to do all of the readings to have a full understanding of the material, the lectures and sections are that good. If you're only concerned about getting an A, then perhaps don't take it since it's kind of hard to know what they want in an essay. Otherwise, such an engaging class, my favorite all year!
Yes. I think this is a fun, interesting, easy course with valuable material and an engaging lecture.
I would recommend this course to any student interested in the law or medicine. It's interesting and does not require a lot of effort.
Yes, really interesting and not too difficult.

I would highly recommend Bioethics and Law.  Especially for people interested in medicine or law, the topics that we discuss are very interesting and controversial.  This gives us good opportunities to try to explain our opinions or attempt to see the argument from another point of view.

I would recommend this course to another student because it was interesting and explained a lot of relevant bioethics issues that continue to evolve.  It's especially helpful to students who are planning to do any kind of research with human subjects in any field.
Yes, you will learn a lot about particular issues that are always controversial. It is important to have a basic understanding on some of these issues and makes you think about each issue in depth.
